name: Square
title: Square
description: How to integrate Square with Make.com

children.text: Square is a platform for payment processing, point-of-sale, and business management. Integrating Square with Make.com allows users to automate sales transactions, sync customer data, and manage inventory across their e-commerce and retail operations.
This is AI-generated content based on official Square documentation. The content may contain mistakes. Please verify important information. If you have questions on vendor documentation, contact
To use the Square app in Make,
you must have a Square developer account and an access token,
To get started, you must first create a connection between Square and
, allowing the two services to communicate.
Obtain your OAuth2.0 credentials in your Square account
Obtain your OAuth2.0 credentials in your Square account
Before you create the connection in
Select your application from the list.
You will use this value while creating a connection in
Because the UI might have changed, the steps you see on your screen might be different,
check the vendor documentation for updates.
, add the Square module to your
If you add a module with an instant tag, click
field, enter a name for the connection.
you copied from your Square account or follow the on-screen instructions to create the connection.
For detailed information on connecting an application, see
After connecting to the Square app, you can choose from a list of available modules to build your
Add a Customer to the Group
Adds a customer to a specified customer group.
Modifies the specified item quantities by applying adjustments and recalculates their totals.
Cancels a previously scheduled appointment; requires a Square Appointments Plus or Premium subscription plan.
Cancels a previously issued invoice, making it void and no longer valid for payment.
Captures and finalizes a payment transaction, transferring the authorized funds from the customer to the merchant.
This module allows you to finalize (capture) a payment that was created with autocomplete set to false, ensuring the payment is completed only when you choose to do so.
Creates a new appointment booking in your Square Appointments calendar. Requires a Square Appointments Plus or Premium subscription plan.
Creates a new payment charge for a customer.
Adds a new payment card to the profile of an existing customer.
Adds a new customer record to your account.
Generates a new digital gift card for a recipient.
Processes a payment by charging a specified payment source, such as a saved customer card or a card nonce.
Initiates a refund for a specific transaction.
Creates a new work shift entry.
Generates a new invoice in draft status, allowing you to review and edit it before finalizing.
Creates a new order in your connected application.
Deletes a specified shift from your account.
Permanently removes a selected invoice from your account.
Retrieves a batch list of orders.
Retrieves a card nonce generated after a user submits a payment form.
Fetches the details of a specific existing booking from your Square Appointments account. Requires a Square Appointments Plus or Premium subscription plan.
Retrieves detailed information about a specific customer.
Fetches the details of a specific, previously issued gift card.
Get a Gift Card by GAN
Fetches the details of an existing gift card using its Gift Account Number (GAN).
Get a Gift Card by Nonce
Fetches the details of a specific gift card using its unique nonce identifier.
Retrieves detailed information about a specific payment using its unique ID.
Fetches detailed information about a specific transaction using its payment ID.
Fetches the details of a specific, previously created shift.
Retrieves detailed information about a specific transaction.
Fetches the details of a specific inventory adjustment record.
Fetches the current physical count of items in your inventory.
Fetches detailed information about a specific inventory transfer.
Fetches the details of a specific invoice that already exists in your account.
Link Customer to a Gift Card
Associates a specific customer with a designated gift card.
Retrieves a complete list of all customer records.
Fetches and displays a list of available gift cards from your account.
Fetches the latest calculated inventory count for a specified catalog item across selected locations.
Fetches a list of all invoices from your account.
Retrieves a list of all recorded payments.
Retrieves a list of all refund transactions.
Retrieves a list of all transactions from your account.
Executes a custom API request to the connected service using your authorized credentials.
Publishes the selected draft invoice, making it a finalized and active invoice.
Processes a refund for a previously completed payment transaction.
Remove a Customer from a Group
Removes a specified customer from a designated customer group.
Searches for specific bookings or retrieves a complete list of all bookings in your Square Appointments account. Requires a Square Appointments Plus or Premium subscription plan.
Retrieves records of past physical inventory counts and any adjustments made, according to the specified filter criteria.
Fetches the latest inventory counts for a specified catalog at the selected locations.
Searches for invoices within a specific location based on the filter criteria you set.
Searches for orders based on specified criteria.
Fetches a list of scheduled work shifts.
Unlink Customer from a Gift Card
Removes the association between a specific customer and a gift card.
Modifies the details of an existing appointment booking; requires a Square Appointments Plus or Premium subscription plan.
Updates the information and details of an existing customer.
Modifies the details of a previously created shift.
Modifies the details of an existing invoice.
Retrieves a list of customers who have been added since the previous check.
Triggers when a payment is processed or a refund is issued using Square Point of Sale or the Transaction API.
Monitors your Square account for new events, such as inventory updates, invoice creations, transactions, disputes, orders, and labor entries.
Retrieves orders that have been created or updated since the last time the module was run.
Retrieves payments that have been newly created or updated since the previous check.
Retrieves transactions that have been newly created or recently updated.
You can look for more templates in
, where you'll find thousands of pre-created

customCSS:
<style>
@media print {
  html, body {
    overflow-x: visible;
  }
}
#tally-widget-button {
  position: fixed !important;
  background-color: #FFFFFF;
  display: none;
  visibility: visible !important;
  opacity: 1 !important;
  color: #0C121D;
  border: 2px solid #0C121D;
  border-radius: 4px;
  align-items: center;
  justify-content: center;
  font-size: 14px;
  font-weight: 600;
  font-family: 'Inter';
  text-align: center;
  box-shadow: 0 4px 6px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.2);
  cursor: pointer;
  z-index: 999999 !important;
  -webkit-tap-highlight-color: transparent;
  outline: none;
  touch-action: manipulation;
  pointer-events: auto;
  transform: translate3d(0, 0, 0);
}
.button-text {
  display: inline-block;
  margin-right: 8px;
}
.button-text::before {
  content: attr(data-text);
}
#tally-widget-popup {
  position: fixed;
  background-color: white;
  display: none;
  border-radius: 12px;
  box-shadow: 0 10px 20px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.4);
  z-index: 999999;
  overflow: hidden;
  border: 0px solid #0C121D;
  padding-top: 30px;
}
#tally-widget-close {
  position: absolute;
  top: 10px;
  right: 10px;
  background: none;
  border: none;
  font-size: 36px;
  font-weight: bold;
  padding: 8px;
  cursor: pointer;
  color: #0C121D;
}

  .ab-plugin-wrapper .ab-link-block-item .ab-link {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
    font-family: 'Inter' !important;
  }

  .dark .ab-plugin-wrapper .ab-link-block-item .ab-link {
    color: #F6F6F6 !important;
  }
  
  #main-column > div > div > div.flex.flex-1.w-full.justify-center.pb-0 > div > div.flex.items-center.pl-0.pr-2.mb-5.xl\:-mt-1\.5 > div > div > div > div:nth-child(1) > div.flex.pr-2.text-gray-500.items-center {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
  }

  a.ab-tree-navigation-link-active span {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
  }

  .ab-public-space-links-wrap .ab-public-space-link:first-of-type {
    border-color: #7302D5 !important;
  }

  .ab-toc-item-active a{
    color: #7302D5 !important;
  }

  #main-column .text-ab-blue-500 span {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
  }
  
  #main-column .text-ab-blue-500 {
    text-decoration-color: #7302D5 !important;
  }
  .ab-nav-left:hover > svg,
  .ab-nav-left:hover .text-gray-300,
  .ab-nav-left:hover .ab-nav-left-text {
     color: #7302D5 !important;
     stroke: #7302D5 !important;
  }
  .ab-nav-right:hover > svg,
  .ab-nav-right:hover .text-gray-300,
  .ab-nav-right:hover .ab-nav-right-text {
     color: #7302D5 !important;
     stroke: #7302D5 !important;
  }
  
#tally-inline-popup {
  position: fixed;
  display: none;
  z-index: 999999;
  width: min(420px, 90vw);
  height: min(550px, 80vh);
  background: #fff;
  color: #0c121d;
  border: 1px solid rgba(0,0,0,0.08);
  border-radius: 12px;
  box-shadow: 0 12px 28px rgba(0,0,0,0.22), 0 2px 6px rgba(0,0,0,0.12);
  overflow: hidden;
  padding: 5px;
}

#tally-inline-popup iframe {
  width: 100%;
  height: 100%;
  border: 0;
  display: block;
  border-radius: 8px;
}

#tally-inline-popup .tip-close {
  position: absolute;
  top: 6px;
  right: 8px;
  width: 32px;
  height: 32px;
  line-height: 28px;
  font-size: 22px;
  text-align: center;
  background: rgba(255,255,255,0.85);
  border: 1px solid rgba(0,0,0,0.06);
  border-radius: 8px;
  cursor: pointer;
}

#main-column a[data-form-url],
#main-column a[data-tally-url] {
  color: #7302D5 !important;
  text-decoration: underline;
  text-underline-offset: 2px;
  text-decoration-thickness: 1.5px;
  font-weight: 600;
}

@media (max-width: 640px) {
  #tally-inline-popup {
    width: min(360px, 94vw);
    height: min(500px, 80vh);
  }
}

#main-column .ab-cta-button a.ab-cta-button {
  background-color: #7302D5;
}

/* Titles in purple */
.ab-link-blocks-wrapper .ab-link-block-item.ab-docs-card-mode .ab-link-block-content-wrap .font-bold {
  color: #7302D5 !important;
}

.ab-tree-navigation-link-active span {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
}

</style>

reusableContentVariables.name: string
reusableContentVariables.description: a list or sequence of characters (like letters, numbers, and symbols) used to represent text in a computer programming.

reusableContentVariables.name: Operations
reusableContentVariables.description: An operation is a single module run to process data or check for new data.

reusableContentVariables.name: Credits
reusableContentVariables.description: Credits (formerly operations) are the currency for running scenarios.

reusableContentVariables.name: Route
reusableContentVariables.description: A route is a path that data can flow through in a scenario, visualized as the dotted lines between modules.
